request.description:
This requests checks if you have already initiated analysis request for the same GSTIN. It is a good idea to check this before initiating a fresh new request.

It will return 200 OK if GSTIN already exists in the system. You can then get on with rest of workflow like OTP auth flow, requesting analysis etc.

If GSTIN does not exist, it will return a 404. Isn't that cool? Well maybe not!

request.description:
This requests creates a new GSTIN for analysis in the system. Creating a new GSTIN does not actually kick-off the analysis. You will have to initiate analysis separately after auth flow.

Note that this step does not need OTP or other credentials for the GST portal. Those parameters are part of a separate API flow (OTP validation). Make sure you are putting GSTIN of the parties you know (like your customers) who have consented to doing this.

request.description: This requests creates a deletes a GSTIN and all the related analysis for that GSTIN from xambit system. Be careful! All data and analysis for that GSTIN will be lost and not recoverable. However, you can re-trigger the analysis request for that GSTIN using other API endpoints. Remember that those API requests cost $$ 😊, so don't delete analysis unless you know why!

item.name: Start OTP Auth Flow for a GSTIN

request.description:
This requests starts the OTP based auth flow for a particular GSTIN. Make sure that you have already created the GSTIN in the system using POST API documented earlier. The workflow is: you'd request OTP by first calling this endpoint and then share the OTP with xAmbit's machines by making call to {{this endpoint}}/valid endpoint once OTP is received (documented next in this collection).  
  
Make sure you've are initiating this on behalf of your customer who has consented for this. You'll need to know their GSTIN portal user name. They'll receive an OTP on official mobile number for consent.  
  
Don't do this on using random GSTINs from public information etc.

response.name: Check if GSTIN analysis exists

item.name: Validate OTP for already initiated Auth Flow for a GSTIN

request.description: This requests starts the validates the OTP received from GSTIN portal by sending it to xAmbit's system. This endpoint should be called only after starting the OTP auth flow using \`start OTP \` part documented earlier.

item.name: Request basic analysis for a GSTIN

request.description:
This is the main endpoint!  
  
This requests creates a new GSTIN basic analysis request. The basic part means that information primarily from GSTR3B will be used to derive the metrics.

This request can be initiated only after you have created the GSTIN in the system and then completed auth flow via OTP. The parameters to be sent are

item.name: Bank Statement Analyser
Create new file collection and analyse file as multi part form

formdata.description: Whether to run aggregation to calculate metrics (should set to true)
Whether to use xAmbit AI to generate summary report
URL to which xAmbit should send reponse
Some parameters like credentials for webhook URL where xAmbit will post the results

request.description:
Create a file collection for bank statement analysis by adding one single file for analysis. This request returns 200 OK if everything is found in order.

The parameters in the header are documented below. Note that this API works on **WebHook Post** basis for response. You do not get bank statement analysis result in response immediately. The result will be posted to the hookurl you have specified in the data!

- Aggregate: bool, if set to true, xAmbit extracts metrics like check bounce count, EMI bounce count etc. Can be set to false if you need only the raw transaction level data from the statement.
    
- Infer: bool, if set to true, xAmbit AI will try to generate a text summary of all the transactional data and its metrics.
    
- hookurl: where to post results of the analysis aka webhook URL
    
- hookauth: if your webhook URL needs some authentication to enable us to post result, set them here as a hashmap key-value pairs.
    
- file: multipart form data which contains actual content of the file to be analysed.

item.name: Create new file collection and analyse with json data

request.description:
Create a file collection for bank statement analysis by adding one single file for analysis. This request returns 200 OK if everything is found in order.

The parameters in the header are documented below. Note that this API works on **WebHook Post** basis for response. You do not get bank statement analysis result in response immediately. The result will be posted to the hookurl you have specified in the data!

- Aggregate: bool, if set to true, xAmbit extracts metrics like check bounce count, EMI bounce count etc. Can be set to false if you need only the raw transaction level data from the statement.
    
- Infer: bool, if set to true, xAmbit AI will try to generate a text summary of all the transactional data and its metrics.
    
- hookurl: where to post results of the analysis aka webhook URL
    
- hookauth: if your webhook URL needs some authentication to enable us to post result, set them here as a hashmap key-value pairs.
    
- file: multipart form data which contains actual content of the file to be analysed.
